markers.description: DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1917 ON NORTH SHORE OF SAGANAGA LAKE, 2-1/8 MILES NORTHEAST OF ENTRANCE TO CACHE BAY, ON SUMMIT OF HIGH ROCK CLIFF, ABOUT 175 METERS (574 FEET) BACK FROM LAKE SHORE, AND ABOUT 50 METERS (164 FEET) ABOVE LAKE LEVEL.  MARKED BY COPPER BOLT STAMPED G.S.C. 1916. FOUR REFERENCE MARKS (NOT DESCRIBED) ARE AS FOLLOWS--NO. 1, 12.40 METERS (40.7 FEET) FROM STATION S 52 DEG 11 MIN W. NO. 2, 14.62 METERS (48.0 FEET) FROM STATION N 28 DEG 18 MIN W.  NO. 3, 10.14 METERS (33.3 FEET) FROM STATION N 83 DEG 29 MIN E.  AND NO. 4, ON BOUNDARY LINE BETWEEN RAINY RIVER AND THUNDER BAY DISTRICTS AND 71.61 METERS (234.9 FEET) FROM STATION N 76 DEG 18 MIN E.

DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1924 (WM) ABOUT 1-1/2 MILES EAST OF NORTH END OF LITTLE VERMILION LAKE, ONE MILE NW OF TROUT LAKE, AND ON ROCK TIMBERED HILL WHICH IS HIGHEST IN VICINITY.  MARKED BY STANDARD BRONZE DISK OF INTERNATIONAL BOUNDARY COMMISSION IN SOLID ROCK.  TO REACH FROM LITTLE VERMILION LAKE, PROCEED TO NARROW BAY ABOUT 2 MILES S OF LITTLE VERMILION NARROWS ON EAST SIDE OF LAKE, GO NORTH 3/4 MILE UP BAY TO 1/4-MILE PORTAGE LEADING EAST TO TROUT LAKE, FOLLOW UP NORTHWEST SHORE OF LAKE TO BLAZED TRAIL LEAVING LAKE FROM SHALLOW BAY JUST SOUTH OF HIGH ROCK BLUFFS AND ABOUT ONE MILE FROM PORTAGE, AND FOLLOW BLAZED TRAIL NORTH ABOUT ONE MILE TO STATION SITE.  REFERENCE MARK IS GEODETIC SURVEY OF CANADA BRONZE DISK IN SOLID ROCK 5.64 METERS (18.5 FEET) FROM STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1948)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1948 (CAS) STATION IS ABOUT 1-1/2 MILES EAST OF NORTH END OF LITTLE VERMILION LAKE, 1 MILE NORTHWEST OF TROUT LAKE, ON A ROCKY TIMBERED HILL WHICH IS THE HIGHEST IN THE VICINITY.  IT IS A STANDARD INTERNATIONAL BOUNDARY COMMISSION DISC WITH A TRIANGLE, SET IN BEDROCK.  THE MARK IS NOT STAMPED.  TO REACH STATION FROM CRANE LAKE POST OFFICE, TAKE MOTOR BOAT TO NORTH END OF CRANE LAKE, THEN NORTH THROUGH NARROWS TO SAND POINT LAKE.  TURN RIGHT AROUND POINT AND GO SOUTHEAST THROUGH LITTLE VERMILION NARROWS AND LITTLE VERMILION LAKE TO A LONG BAY LEADING NORTH FROM LITTLE VERMILION LAKE, 2 MILES SOUTHEAST OF THE NORTH END OF LAKE.  GO NORTH TO END OF BAY, AND AN OLD ABANDONED CAMP WITH THREE CABINS STILL STANDING.  FROM HERE TAKE WELL DEFINED TRAIL EAST FOR APPROXIMATELY ONE-QUARTER MILE TO TROUT LAKE.  BY BOAT, GO NORTHEAST ALONG THE NORTHWEST SHORE OF TROUT LAKE FOR 1 MILE TO LAST LARGE BAY ON THE NORTHWEST SHORE, AND A TRIANGULAR BLAZED PINE AT THE ROCK LEDGE SHORE LINE.  FROM HERE FOLLOW A WELL BLAZED TRAIL UP HILL IN A NORTHERLY DIRECTION FOR ONE-HALF MILE TO WHERE THE TIMBER THINS OUT, AND THE BLAZES ARE FARTHER APART.  CONTINUE IN A NORTHERLY DIRECTION ALONG ROCKY RIDGE FOR ONE-HALF MILE TO THE HIGHEST POINT AT THE NORTH EDGE OF RIDGE AND THE STATION.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 1 IS A GEODETIC SURVEY OF CANADA STANDARD BRONZE DISC SET IN BEDROCK AND STAMPED VERMILLIAN.  IT IS SOUTH OF THE STATION.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 2 IS A STANDARD USC AND GS BRONZE DISC SET IN BEDROCK AND STAMPED VERMILLION NO 2 1924 IBC.  IT IS EAST OF THE STATION.  AZIMUTH MARK IS A STANDARD BRONZE DISC SET IN BEDROCK AND STAMPED VERMILLION 1924.  IT IS APPROX. 0.6 MILE EAST-SOUTH-EAST OF THE STATION.  WALTER SCOTT, A GUIDE WHO LIVES ON CRANE LAKE, NEAR THE POST OFFICE, HAS A GOOD BOAT AND HAVING BEEN TO THE STATION ON SEVERAL OCCASIONS KNOWS ITS LOCATION, AND WHERE THE LINES HAVE BEEN CLEARED TO OTHER STATIONS.

DESCRIBED BY INTERNATIONAL BOUNDARY COMMISSION 1943 (JH) ON OLD VESSEL POINT, ABOUT 1-1/2 MILES UPRIVER FROM ALGOMA STEEL PLANT.  STATION IS ON LOW GROUND JUST OFF THE MAIN - LAND WHERE A ROCK REEF RUNS OUT FROM THE POINT ABOUT 100 FEET INTO THE RIVER. ABOUT 90 FEET S OF A SUMMER COTTAGE.  THE GROUND IS ABOUT LEVEL WITH HIGH - WATER MARK.  STATION MARK IS A NAIL IN A HUB FLUSH WITH THE GROUND.  THREE REFERENCE MARKS WERE ESTABLISHED--NO 1 IS A 1-INCH DRILL HOLE 1 INCH DEEP ON A BOULDER 5 BY 5 BY 3 FEET HIGH 9.69 FEET FROM STATION, S 57 DEG 45 MIN W.  NO 2 IS A 1-INCH DRILL HOLE 1/2 INCH DEEP IN A FLINTY ROCK 74.95 FEET FROM STATION AZIMUTH 188 DEGREE 53 MINUTES 36 SECONDS.  AN I B C STANDARD BRONZE - DISK STATION MARK IS CEMENTED INTO A DRILL HOLE IN A ROUNDED ROCK 4 FEET IN DIAMETER WITH APEX 1-1/2 FEET ABOVE GROUND 84.67 FEET FROM THE STATION, N 02 DEG 40 MIN E.  THE DISK IS 13.03 FEET NW FROM REFERENCE MARK 2, 5 FEET S OF THE S CORNER OF THE COTTAGE, AND 30.2 FEET FROM THE E CORNER OF THE COTTAGE.
